alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Liberty, southwestern Hill and north central Chouteau Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 827 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles north of Fort Benton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenilworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for north central Montana.
